author: sucy
title: Virtual Billboard
description: People are buying land and more on the blockchain. Users can advertise these assets and more within the Metaverse with virtual billboards.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to create an ad selling platform, where companies can advertise assets and services virtually. It is no secret that metaverse projects have been blowing up lately, and this proposal seems to go hand in hand with that. I would have liked to see a more clear or detailed formulation of the problem statement and solution, and foremost how it is related to the growth of Cardano. I'm assuming that the platform will be built upon Cardano or use it in some way, but this is not clear since the team aims to build the platform on top of an already existing platform. In order to assess this proposal properly, I would have liked to see a more thorough explanation of 1: what the project is and how it will be developed? 2: How it will meet the needs of the users of Cardano? And lastly 3: What will the proposal provide to the ecosystem? If lots of advertisements on different platforms will attract larger companies to advertise on the platform, describe how the team aims to achieve that, and how it will bring value to the whole picture. Where will the focus lie? The immutability of blockchain tech might indeed revolutionize many different industries, but in order for me (as an experienced Community Advisor) to fairly assess the impact of the proposal, it would need to contain more details. Since the requested funding is quite substantial of over 20% of the total challenge budget, this kind of information is important. There is nothing wrong with the core concept, I would just like to know more.  All in all, I disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
I believe that this proposal would benefit highly from a short presentation of the core team, along with sufficient links provided to verify their competency and experience. Maybe a link to previous projects, or LinkedIn profiles? If the team has 12 years experience of developing high-end and managing Times Square ad campaigns, there should be plenty of information to share from that. And all that information would benefit the proposal. Having said that, the team DOES refer to their project GOTIGER (when asked for some info about the team in the comments), but sadly there is not much information related to either the team or this particular project to be found there. 

This goes hand in hand with the budget allocation, which I would like to be a bit more detailed. For example, knowing how many Product Managers or Developers are part of the team, how the budget will be allocated between the individuals along with how many working hours that are estimated for each position would really increase the feasibility of the proposal. And subsequently, the faith in the team. Lastly, for the proposal to be more tangible I would have liked to see a further explanation of what the project aims to do, in detail. In order for it to be understood by CAs and the public in general it would need to contain explanations that immediately say if the proposal aims to have their Virtual Billboards in already existing metaverses, or if they mean to host their own spaces. I might be wrong in questioning the tangibility of the proposals explanations, and would gladly stand corrected if that is the case. Due to the lack of information provided in the proposal, I disagree that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes some valuable information about measurements of success, and KPIs, even though it would benefit from more detail. If there had been a road map with milestones and estimated timeframes added and then merged with some KPI info, I believe that it would increase the quality of the proposal greatly. For example: After 3 months after being funded, we aim to have embedded 5 virtual cities within the system, after 6 months we hope to have 25 active advertising campaigns (minimum) in each virtual city. After 12 months we will gather information on how much presence our project will have in social media, and measure the levels of success according to this scale: [numbers]. Again, these explanations are only gibberish. What I'm trying to say needs clarification is the concept and presentation. Also, a channel where the community or investors/users of the platforms can monitor and interact with the proposers would further increase the level of auditability of the project as a whole. From my experience as a Community Advisor and working with Blockchain technology, transparency is an integral part of it. If this proposal would reflect that kind of transparency towards its users and investors, it would benefit it greatly. A short description of potential risks and hinders of development would also strengthen the faith in the competency of the team, and proof that the team has a deep understanding and perspective of the industry and the project. Overall, I disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

How this number of 60k$ is reached, this is quite a high amount, but no further information is given on how many developers will work, what is the distribution model for the budget e.g. front end, back end, smart contract, testing etc, monthly rate OR hourly rates

f6_assessments.q1: Team have 12 years of experiences in real life, this project seems a little ambitious. Although they said it was easier to build a virtual billboard in the metaverse, the proponents didn't say anything about the schedule or what they would be working on. This proposal did not mention anything how much time they will work on, what metaverse they already research and approach to take partnership with, or when they will finish the product. Budgets are only written in general without further explanation. The author replied to some comments asking for information about the team with the link THEGOTIGER.com, but the credentials and or experiences of the members are still nowhere to be found.
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs are clearly written with a simple way. But without a  detail roadmap, this proposal becomes difficult to audit publicly. KPI wanted us to know that the team would be creating a virtual billboard in metaverse cities/lands. But the proposer did not mention what specific virtual cities/lands they would approach. At least the proposer should already have done a little research on what virtual cities/land would be interesting to build a virtual billboard, that would be great.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a revolutionary idea in which the proposer clearly explain the problem and offers a great solution. Definitely such projects have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem but it is not explained how this idea would have an impact on the Cardano ecosystem nor is Cardano mentioned at all. The KPIs cited by the proposer partially correspond to the ones indicated in the challenge and proposal is not able to scale and address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The link to the website that the team provided is not transparent. We do not know how many people would work on this project and we do not have a clear insight into whether there are skills, knowledge and experience needed to realize this idea. We do not have information on the website how this idea will be realized and adapted to Cardano and there is no indication that there is experience and skill required for such an operation. The budget is clearly presented but not realistic and is not broken down into identifiable items. The plan was not elaborated in the proposal and details of actionable tasks and order of execution were not presented. It would be great to present a time frame within on how to implement this idea with clear dates and to list the necessary resources and technical aspects of the implementation itself. Unfortunately the proposal does not mention possible risks.
f6_assessments.q2: It would be great if this superb idea was followed by a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement and if the KPIs where worked out everything would be in place. Unfortunately, the community cannot follow the further development of this idea due to lack of information.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal assumes the metaverse is already in existence, something already running on Cardano, rather than something which will take years, to decades to build. 
The impact of the project presented in the proposal would be non-existent, simply because what is being proposed can't be deployed at this point in time. This will surely still be the case in the timeframe presented in the proposal, of a few months.
It's this CA's assumption that the proposers are simply trying to play on the metaverse hype, without giving too much thought to the concept.
I would recommend studying the topics of blockchain and metaverse more before potentially resubmitting the proposal. Digital advertising in the metaverse is sure to be an explosive topic once the metaverse is actually implemented.
f6_assessments.q1:
Besides the concept of "billboards in the metaverse", almost no details are given about how the project would actually work, making it almost impossible to assess if it can be successfully completed.
I would suggest a stronger emphasis on the "how" of the project next time.
A brief mention regarding the team behind the proposal is made, however, no actual identifying information is given, even though the "Included identifying information about all proposers" requirement was marked as successfully completed in the self-assessment checklist. Not knowing who is behind the project makes it very hard to assess if it would actually be completed. No mention is made about if and what roles would need to be recruited for.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPIs are very vague and don't go in-depth, and no definitions of success are given making tracking the deliverables of the project a very hard task.
The breakdown of the budget is very shallow in its current form. I would suggest giving it more thought and elaborating more on each budget line before resubmitting the proposal.
